content.webTitle: Last chance to go for the snow

fields.headline: Last chance to go for the snow
fields.bodyText: Be cool - and stay warm The Buff is the latest in cool yet practical kids' skiwear. A versatile hat/neckerchief, it's worn in the style that suits you that day. Available in junior, baby, and even adult styles. The Junior Buff costs £20 from Young Explorers (01789 414791). Carry on It's a slog carrying skis, so invest in this clever device to make life easier for the little ones. The Skiloop hooks over the ski tips and bindings, then over the shoulder, rather like a bag strap. It costs £9.99 from Kidski (01202 631222). Light, bright and comfy Protect the kids in a comfy way with Cébé's no-gravity helmets. They're lighter than traditional headgear, but have a double shell that helps take away the heat from the head without letting in the cold mountain air. In four colours - sky blue, white, silver or black - they cost £75. For stockists, call 01635 277288. Give them the slip It's a great way to see the slopes if you're small enough. The Baby Luge has a three-point seat belt, non-slip footrests, soft rubber seat plus a handle for mum or dad to pull on. It costs £28.95 from Urchin (0870 720 0709). Slip slap slope Keep your little ones safe from the harmful rays of the sun with the Soltan kids colour face stick, above, from Boots. It adds some fun to sun protection and comes at a highly reassuring SPF 50+ for £5.99. For stockists call 08450 708090. High fashion When the helmet comes off, put the hat on. Kids will go wild for the Giraffy fleece hat from Barts (£14 one size), available through Cotswold Outdoor (01666 575575), which also has a range of other fun hats.
